title.value: Cell ontology guided transcriptome foundation model
title.justification: The title is extracted directly from the beginning of the provided paper.
title.quote: Cell ontology guided transcriptome foundation model

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel cell ontology-guided transcriptome foundation model, scCello, which leverages cell ontology information to improve the pre-training of transcriptome foundation models on single-cell RNA sequencing data. By incorporating cell-type coherence loss and ontology alignment loss with masked gene expression prediction, scCello enhances cell representation learning and maintains general-purpose adaptability for various downstream tasks.

type.justification: The paper describes experiments with the scCello model on a dataset of 22 million cells, measuring its performance on various tasks. This indicates empirical research focusing on implementing and testing a new method.
type.quote: We demonstrate the generalizability and transferability of scCello on 22 million cells from CellxGene.

name.justification: The paper focuses on transcriptome foundation models (TFMs), specifically dealing with single-cell RNA sequencing data and cell ontology.
name.quote: Transcriptome foundation models (TFMs) hold great promises of deciphering the transcriptomic language.

name.justification: The paper discusses using single-cell RNA sequencing data extensively as part of their research and experiments.
name.quote: In this context, single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) has emerged as a pivotal technique to measure the gene expression in individual cells.

name.justification: The model is introduced as a novel approach in the paper, aimed at improving transcriptome foundation models by integrating cell ontology.
name.quote: To capture this intuition, we propose scCello, a single cell, Cell-ontology guided TFM.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents scCello as a novel model developed by the authors to improve cell-type representation learning.
is_contributed.quote: To capture this intuition, we propose scCello, a single cell, Cell-ontology guided TFM.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions the execution and benchmarking of scCello in various experimental setups.
is_executed.quote: We demonstrate the generalizability and transferability of scCello on 22 million cells from CellxGene.

is_compared.justification: scCello is benchmarked against other transcriptome foundation models and non-TFM methods in different tasks, showing its performance metrics.
is_compared.quote: In Tab. 2, The fine-tuned scCello outperforms other TFMs on both classification and clustering metrics.

referenced_paper_title.justification: As an original contribution of this paper, there is no reference to a prior work specifically dedicated to scCello.

name.justification: The dataset used for the pre-training of scCello with 22 million cells is mentioned as coming from the CellxGene database.
name.quote: We pre-trained scCello on 22 million cells from CellxGene database.

referenced_paper_title.value: Cz cell×gene discover: A single-cell data platform for scalable exploration, analysis and modeling of aggregated data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title of the paper provides relevant context for the CellxGene dataset used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Cz cell×gene discover: A single-cell data platform for scalable exploration, analysis and modeling of aggregated data.

name.justification: The PPR algorithm used in the paper was implemented using NetworkX, as explicitly mentioned.
name.quote: We implemented PPR using the 'pagerank' function in NetworkX.

referenced_paper_title.value: Exploring network structure, dynamics, and function using NetworkX
referenced_paper_title.justification: A paper titled 'Exploring network structure, dynamics, and function using NetworkX' is referenced, providing background for using this library.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Exploring network structure, dynamics, and function using NetworkX.
